error.signature: Error: Resource not accessible by integration (403)
error.regex: (?:Resource not accessible by integration|403 Forbidden|HttpError: Resource not accessible)

verdict.summary: GitHub Actions workflow lacks required permissions to access repository resources such as packages, issues, pull requests, or deployments. The GITHUB_TOKEN has insufficient scopes.

dead_ends.action: Use a personal access token (PAT) with full repo scope as a workaround
dead_ends.why_fails: Over-privileged tokens create security risks and PATs can expire, causing future failures; the root cause is incorrect workflow permissions

dead_ends.action: Set all permissions to write without understanding which are needed
dead_ends.why_fails: Violates principle of least privilege and may be blocked by organization-level permission policies

workarounds.action: Add explicit permissions block to the workflow with only the required scopes
workarounds.how: Add 'permissions:' at the job or workflow level with specific scopes like 'contents: read', 'packages: write', 'pull-requests: write' as needed

workarounds.action: Check and update organization/repository default workflow permissions
workarounds.how: Go to Settings > Actions > General > Workflow permissions and ensure 'Read and write permissions' is selected, or grant specific permissions

leads_to.condition: When permission issues also affect checkout authentication

preceded_by.condition: When fixing syntax errors reveals underlying permission problems

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Permission denied is about GITHUB_TOKEN scopes; secret not found is about missing repository/environment secrets
